short_desc: Report emails or SMS pretending to be myGov, Centrelink or ATO. Includes fake tax refund or account suspension notices. Use ATO link to check if it’s a scam.
Report stolen identity details such as Medicare, driver’s licence or bank info. The ACSC will guide you through recovery and protection steps.
Report hacking attempts, such as email or social media accounts taken over, or suspicious software installed. Helps track scam trends nationally.
If someone tricked you into installing remote-control software (e.g., pretending to be Microsoft or Telstra), report here to get help recovering
For scams where someone ‘accidentally’ overpays and asks you to refund the extra money, report to Scamwatch to prevent repeat targeting
Report unexpected charges from SMS subscriptions or fake competitions that add costs to your phone bill.
Report fake health cures, COVID-19 treatments, or unsafe medical devices sold online.
Report scams on buy/sell platforms (like Gumtree or Facebook Marketplace), such as fake sellers or buyers requesting upfront payments
Report fake online stores, non-delivery of goods, or counterfeit products bought through websites or ads.
Report fake invoices, advertising renewals, or domain name bills sent to trick businesses and individuals into paying.

category_key: Threats to life, arrest or other
short_desc: Report threatening calls or messages pretending to be police, tax office or other government demanding money or arrest
Report fake investment opportunities, crypto schemes, or financial services offering ‘guaranteed’ returns
Report fake online partners who build trust and then ask for money, gifts, or personal details
Report people pretending to raise money for disasters, medical causes or charities without approva
Report fake lottery or prize messages that ask you to pay fees or share bank details before collecting winnings
Report fake refund offers, like tax rebates, energy bill discounts, or bank overpayments requiring you to hand over money first.
Report fake job ads, work-from-home offers, or recruiters who ask for upfront fees, training payments or reshipping tasks
“Report scams offering free or discounted holidays that require hidden fees, card details, or fake travel vouchers.”
